name: places/ChIJ4_EelTxawokRIrVex08F1xQ
formattedAddress: 111 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA
adrFormatAddress: 111 South St, New York, NY 10038, USA

editorialSummary.text: Longtime neighborhood bar/eatery offering oysters, clams & other seafood staples in old-school digs.

originalText.text: We loved our evening at Fish Market! An unassuming local bar that has delicious food and amazing service! Our server, John, was so friendly & pleasant! He gave us recommendations on the menu, Jameson shots on the house, and even gave me a little extra wine after I accidentally spilled some on the table (oops!). The atmosphere is so chill. No frills. But delicious food and friendly staff!

text.text: We loved our evening at Fish Market! An unassuming local bar that has delicious food and amazing service! Our server, John, was so friendly & pleasant! He gave us recommendations on the menu, Jameson shots on the house, and even gave me a little extra wine after I accidentally spilled some on the table (oops!). The atmosphere is so chill. No frills. But delicious food and friendly staff!

originalText.text:
Possibly the greatest dive bar in the entire city! It was packed for college football when I was there. The Jack and Coke and Jameson was flowing. The ambiance was fun, controlled chaos. And the owner, Jeff, was behind the bar making sure all were having a good time too.

The "Drunken Fish Soup" looks great for hangovers and colds. Need to get me that again soon. Good times were had by all! Most definitely coming back again soon

text.text:

originalText.text:
I was surprised about this place, The Fish Market. I found this place online through Yelp. I initially thought that it was a restaurant,  but when I showed up there with my friend,  I realized that it was a bar.
We went in anyway because I was really looking forward to trying the crispy fried rice with chicken. My friend was game to try anything on the menu.  He had their burger with fries.
The food was surprisingly very good! I thought my dish was very tasty. My friend liked his meal just fine.
The atmosphere of the place was like most sports/dive bars; most patrons hanging/sitting at the bar, drinking, etc., loud music, but not enough to where you couldn't hear yourself talk, and big screen TVs showing sports and sports memorabilia on the walls finished off the spaces.
Overall,  my friend and I had a good time at The Fish Market.  The service was good.  We didn't wait long for the food, and the prices were rather affordable for the amount of food you received. I will go back there again in the future and try some of their other menu options.

originalText.text: Loved this dive bar! Adam was a fantastic host and we had a few shots together. Mama's Fried Rice is AMAZING! I will definitely return when I visit NYC again. Getting in was hard because the door does not have a handle/knob. Find the top edge of the door to open it.

text.text: Loved this dive bar! Adam was a fantastic host and we had a few shots together. Mama's Fried Rice is AMAZING! I will definitely return when I visit NYC again. Getting in was hard because the door does not have a handle/knob. Find the top edge of the door to open it.

originalText.text:
What a random but great find. It’s a divey sports bar but also a Malaysian restaurant. Staff were great - so friendly and handing out Jameson shots.
We enjoyed the fried chicken (so crunchy) and the Sambal cod special
